unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: World Geography Test: Find the $p$-Value
question_text: Can Canadian adults identify more countries of the world on a map than American adults? Researchers tested a random sample of $50$ Canadian adults and  a random sample of $50$ American adults. On average, the selected Canadian adults could identify $23.92$ countries with a standard deviation of $4.8$ , while Americans in the sample could identify $22.61$ countries with a standard deviation of $6.2$ . Assuming all conditions are satisfied, what is the $p$ -value of the appropriate test?
